titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York State Militia, 22nd Brigade general order books 1977.191
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:47 +0000.

did.unittitle: New York State Militia, 22nd Brigade general order books
did.abstract: Two handwritten bound volumes of general orders for the 22nd Brigade of the New York State Militia, issued by Brigadier General Jeremiah Johnson. The order books date from 1814 to 1815.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New York State Militia, 22nd Brigade general order books, 1977.191, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The 22nd Brigade of the New York State Militia was stationed at Fort Greene in Brooklyn during the War of 1812 and was under the command of General Jeremiah Johnson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two handwritten bound volumes of general orders for the 22nd Brigade of the New York State Militia, issued by Brigadier General Jeremiah Johnson. The order books date from 1814 to 1815.
